comment._content: McNamee worked for New York radio station WEAF in January, 1925, the date on the negative. This is likely the WEAF broadcast studio. The microphone is a Western Electric model "widely used in radio broadcasting 1921-1931." www.aes.org/aeshc/docs/recording.technology.history/micro... An undated photo of the WEAF studio has the same furnishings and curtained walls. uv201.com/framepage1.htm Another view of WEAF's facilities in 1924: ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81w8JnCgYoL._SL1266_.jpg A more exact identification in notes under
